channel.description: Recent content in Ticket Management on SmartWeb Support

item.title: Can multiple people use it simultaneously?
item.description:
Simultaneous Use by Multiple Operators link

Yes, LiveAgent is a team-oriented helpdesk system that allows multiple operators to use it simultaneously.

Agent Collision Detection link

LiveAgent is equipped with the Agent Collision Detection feature, which prevents confusion when multiple operators try to respond to the same ticket.

Information Displayed link

Status Display Content
Viewing Who is viewing that ticket
Replying Who is creating a response to that ticket

How It Works link

  1. Real-time Detection - When a ticket is opened, other operators are immediately notified of the situation
  2. Duplicate Response Prevention - A warning appears when trying to open a ticket already being handled
  3. To Solve Algorithm Integration - Works with automatic assignment, preventing tickets being handled from being assigned to other operators

Benefits of Team Use link

Benefit Description
Improved Efficiency Eliminates duplicate work on the same ticket
Enhanced Customer Experience Prevents confusion from multiple responses to one inquiry
Team Collaboration Real-time awareness of who is handling what

Available Plans link

The Agent Collision Detection feature is available on all LiveAgent plans (Small, Medium, Large, Enterprise).

item.title: Can I merge tickets?
item.description:
Yes, SmartWeb’s AI-integrated ticketing system allows you to merge multiple tickets into one.

Situations where ticket merging is useful link

  • When the same customer contacts you about the same issue via both email and chat
  • When multiple tickets are created for the same content
  • When inquiries are scattered and management becomes complicated

Benefits of merging link

  • Prevention of duplicate responses: Prevents mistakes where multiple agents respond to the same inquiry
  • Centralized history: All interactions can be viewed in a single thread
  • Improved response quality: Eliminates the need to make customers repeat the same explanation

How to operate link

  1. Open the ticket you want to merge and select “Merge” from the “More” button
  2. Enter the ticket number of the destination ticket
  3. Select tag and recipient merge options as needed
  4. Click the “Merge” button to execute

Note: Merging cannot be undone. Please confirm the destination ticket number before executing.

item.title: Can tickets be split?
item.description:
Yes, SmartWeb’s AI-integrated ticketing system allows you to split one ticket into multiple tickets.

Situations Where Ticket Splitting is Useful link

  • When one inquiry contains multiple questions
  • When multiple issues have different progress statuses
  • When part of the issue needs to be transferred (escalated) to another team or person

Benefits of Splitting link

  • Proper assignment to specialized departments: Technical questions and billing questions can be assigned to different personnel
  • Prevention of missed responses: All questions can be answered reliably
  • Improved response speed: Each issue can be processed in parallel

How to Split link

  1. Display the details screen of the ticket you want to split
  2. Select “Split” from the “▼” dropdown in the upper right
  3. A new ticket will be created that inherits the previous response log
  4. Transfer the split ticket to the appropriate person if necessary

After splitting, both tickets remain linked and can be referenced by following the links.

item.title: Can automatic reply emails be sent after ticket creation?
item.description:
Yes, SmartWeb’s AI-integrated ticket system allows you to set up automatic replies using the rules feature.

Available Automatic Replies link

  • Email inquiries: Automatically send confirmation emails when new tickets are created
  • Contact form submissions: Automatic responses for receipt confirmation
  • Condition-based automatic responses: Customization based on department or inquiry content

Configuration Points link

Recommended: Use “Send Answer” Action link

We recommend using the “send answer” action for automatic replies. This prevents infinite loops when customers also have automatic replies configured, avoiding mutual auto-response cycles.

item.title: About Automatic Spam Detection
item.description:
Spam Detection Mechanism link

Spam Filter Learning Mechanism link

The ticket spam detection mechanism is a learning-type spam filter that improves accuracy by repeatedly having agents manually mark inappropriate tickets as “spam”.

How to Mark Tickets as Spam link

To mark a ticket as spam, agents click the “Spam” button at the bottom of the individual ticket screen.

Improving Filtering Accuracy link

Initial Stage Filtering link

The filtering strength may not be very high when LiveAgent is first implemented.

item.title: About File Attachments
item.description:
File Attachment Overview link

LiveAgent allows you to easily send and receive attachments in multiple formats. In business communication, the attachment feature plays an important role and enables smooth information sharing.

How to Attach Files link

Attachment Procedure link

When sending emails from LiveAgent, click the “clip” icon at the bottom of the send form to attach files. You can easily attach files following these steps:

  • Click the icon
  • Select a file from your local device
  • Confirm the file to be attached

Saving Attached Files link

Attached files are automatically saved within the related ticket, regardless of whether they are sent or received. This provides the following benefits:

item.title: Adding 'Tags' to Smart Tickets
item.description:
What is the Smart Ticket Tag Feature link

By adding arbitrary tags to tickets, you can streamline the identification of frequently inquired products and categorization of inquiry content.

Tag Management and Usage Methods link

Tag Creation Steps link

From the agent screen left menu, select Settings > Automation > Tags > Create.

  • Click the “Create” button, set the “Tag Name,” “Text Color,” and “Background Color” to complete creation. For editing such as name changes, click “Edit” for each tag.

Adding Tags to Tickets link

To insert created tags into received tickets, open the ticket, click “+,” select the appropriate tag, and click “Close Window.” When you check the ticket screen, the tag has been added.

item.title: Adding Agents
item.description:
Overview of Adding Agents link

Instant Addition Features link

Even when you need to quickly increase the number of agents for urgent situations, you can add them instantly by yourself.

There is no need to contact the operating company (InterWork), submit applications, or wait for configuration.

How to Change the Number of Agents link

Steps for Adding and Removing link

You can add/remove agents in “Settings” - “Agents” from the agent login screen.

item.title: Agent Availability
item.description:
What is Agent Availability link

Definition and Basic Concepts link

Agent availability is a feature that allows real-time monitoring of each agent’s operational status, such as “online,” “offline,” or “busy.” It enables administrators and the entire team to instantly identify who is immediately available to respond to customer inquiries, optimizing support operations.

Practical Benefits link

Real-time Resource Management link

For example, when inquiries surge during busy periods, administrators can understand agent operational status and appropriately reallocate resources. Even in teams that combine work shifts and remote work, being able to check availability at a glance helps prevent gaps in coverage. This allows customers to receive smooth support without waiting.

item.title: Agent collision detection
item.description:
Overview of Agent Collision Detection link

Purpose of the Feature link

This feature prevents multiple agents from simultaneously handling the same ticket. It eliminates duplicate responses to customers and wasted work, enabling efficient and consistent support.

Importance of Collision Avoidance link

For example, when multiple agents attempt to respond simultaneously to an urgent customer request, the customer may become confused and trust may be damaged. The collision detection feature displays warnings for tickets being handled, preventing duplicate responses.

item.title: Agent Ranking Overview
item.description:
Agent Ranking Overview link

Agent Ranking is a feature that quantifies and ranks each agent’s performance based on customer feedback and support achievements. It serves as a direct indicator of customer satisfaction and helps visualize service quality.

How Ranking Works link

For example, when customers provide evaluations through surveys after support sessions end, that data is automatically aggregated and reflected in the rankings. Managers can use this to identify excellent agents and leverage the information for recognition and incentive programs.

item.title: Agent Rating
item.description:
Agent Rating Overview link

A system that allows customers to evaluate agent responses. After support completion, customers can provide satisfaction feedback, and this data is used to visualize each agent’s performance.

Purpose and Significance of Rating link

For example, when customers evaluate “response speed” and “courtesy” in customer surveys, improvement points and strengths become clear, which is useful for education and incentive design. Rankings also contribute to improving the motivation of the entire team.

item.title: Agent Report
item.description:
What is Agent Report link

Agent Report is a feature that provides detailed reports on the number of tickets processed by individual agents, average response times, resolution rates, and more. It enables objective performance assessment and is essential for team management.

Benefits of Data Analysis link

By analyzing data on a daily, weekly, and monthly basis, you can understand who excels at which tasks. For example, you can identify personnel who can resolve large volumes of tickets in a short time or those who provide high customer satisfaction responses.

item.title: Agents
item.description:
What are Agents link

In LiveAgent, “Agents” refer to staff members who handle customer inquiries.

Role of Agents link

They are responsible for processing inquiries that come through multiple channels such as email, chat, phone, and social media.

Features of Agent Management link

Flexible Addition and Removal link

For example, you can start with a small team and invite new agents one after another as your business expands. Since unlimited additions are possible, it can flexibly accommodate everything from startups to large enterprises.

item.title: Are there limits on the number of smart tickets stored or data capacity?
item.description:
Data Storage Limits for Smart Tickets link

Basic Data Storage Policy link

SmartWeb’s smart ticket system provides flexibility and convenience in user data management. There are no capacity or quantity limits for data storage, including tickets, attachments, and user forum posts. This means you can store an unlimited number of tickets and related information as your business grows.

Key features:

  • Unlimited ticket creation
  • Large file attachment capability
  • Comprehensive storage of historical data

Data Retention Period link

SmartWeb securely retains all data throughout your contract period unless explicitly deleted. This allows you to reference important customer service records and issue resolution history over the long term. Data storage strongly supports business continuity and knowledge management.

item.title: Attachments
item.description:
Overview of Attachment Feature link

The attachment feature is a convenient function that allows you to attach files to tickets. You can easily share images, audio, documents, and other files to supplement customer interactions.

Benefits of Attachments link

For example, when a customer reports a product issue and attaches a screenshot, agents can accurately understand the situation. This also expands the scope of responses, such as sending manuals as supplementary information for answers.

item.title: Automated Ticket Distribution
item.description:
Overview of Automated Ticket Distribution link

Purpose of the Feature link

This is a feature that automatically distributes tickets to agents. It equalizes workload and prevents agents from selecting tickets, achieving an efficient and fair support system.

Main Benefits link

Flexible Distribution Mechanism link

For example, even when inquiries surge suddenly, the automatic distribution feature ensures tickets are properly allocated to appropriate agents.

Skill-Based Assignment link

Skill-based distribution is also possible, allowing priority assignment to personnel with specialized knowledge.

item.title: Can it integrate with our currently operating CRM?
item.description:
About LiveAgent API Integration link

LiveAgent provides APIs that enable flexible integration with your existing systems. This realizes solutions that greatly improve enterprise operational efficiency and enhance the quality of customer support.

API Integration Features link

LiveAgent’s API provides powerful functionality that enables seamless integration between customer support systems and existing business systems. With RESTful API design, simple and secure data integration is possible, realizing an intuitive interface for developers.

item.title: Can multiple questions in one smart ticket be managed separately?
item.description:
Overview of Ticket Splitting link

What is Ticket Splitting link

Ticket splitting is a feature that allows you to manage multiple questions or cases within a single ticket as individual items. This feature enables efficient tracking and handling of different types of inquiries or issues.

Benefits of Ticket Splitting link

Efficient Case Management link

  • You can track multiple questions individually, providing clear visibility into response status
  • Different assignees or priorities can be set for each question or case
  • Progress can be managed in detail for each item, improving overall response quality

Flexible Response link

Ticket splitting enables flexible responses in the following ways:

item.title: Can tickets marked as spam be restored?
item.description:
How to restore tickets marked as spam link

Tickets marked as spam can be manually restored to the ticket list from the agent screen.

【Related items】　About automatic spam detection

Ticket restoration procedure link

  1. Search in the agent screen
  • From the left menu of the agent screen, select “Search” > “Tickets”, then click “Custom search conditions”

Filtering spam tickets link

  • In the search conditions “Status”, check only “Spam”, then click “Apply”

Restoring tickets link

  • Tickets excluded as spam will be displayed in the list

item.title: Connecting LiveAgent to Gmail/G Suite
item.description:
How to Connect LiveAgent with Gmail link

Gmail Connection in Cloud Version LiveAgent link

Connection Steps link

Cloud version LiveAgent accounts connect to Gmail accounts using Google’s OAuth authentication. By authorizing this connection in a popup window, your Gmail mailbox will be connected with no further configuration required.

  1. Log into LiveAgent and open the email account settings screen.
  2. Select “Settings” > “Email” > “Mail accounts”
  3. Click “Add mail account” and select the Gmail connector
  4. Authorize your Gmail account in the popup window
  5. Specify the mailbox “Team” and save

Gmail Connection in Software Version LiveAgent link

Basic Connection Steps link

LiveAgent (software version) connects via IMAP/POP3 and SMTP servers using your Gmail username and password.

item.title: Copy & Paste Images
item.description:
Overview of Copy & Paste Images Feature link

A feature that allows you to insert images directly into tickets using copy & paste. You can share screenshots without saving them as files, improving support speed and convenience.

Benefits for Technical Support link

Particularly in technical support, you can paste error screens or operation procedures on the spot, enabling quick understanding of customer issues. This reduces the time needed to resolve problems.

item.title: Customer reply emails are not being associated with the smart ticket being handled.
item.description:
Mechanism for Associating Ticket Reply Emails link

Email Subject Line and Automatic Association link

When sending an email to a customer from a ticket, the [ticket number] is automatically added to the subject line. This mechanism allows support teams to efficiently track communication with customers. For example, the ticket number is inserted into the subject line in a format like [#12345] Regarding Support Request.

SmartWeb’s smart ticket system makes email reply tracking and management easy through this unique automatic tagging feature. Support staff can always maintain context of conversations through the ticket number.

item.title: Display External Information in Tickets
item.description:
Display External Information in Tickets Plugin Overview link

Since version 4.25.6.4, LiveAgent has added a plugin called “Display External Information in Tickets” that allows agents to load data from external servers or applications when opening tickets. As some development skills are required to create connections, this plugin becomes a very useful tool for agents to find detailed information about external systems.

Plugin Use Cases link

For example, by calling an e-commerce system’s API to list the last orders of the customer the agent is currently communicating with, agents can directly check what the customer ordered in their store within the LiveAgent backend. The plugin’s possibilities are extensive and can save many unnecessary clicks for your agents.

item.title: Editing Email Templates
item.description:
Overview of Email Templates link

To quickly respond to emails, LiveAgent allows you to create and store email templates in the system. There are two types of email templates: customer-facing and agent-facing.

Email Template Configuration link

Navigating to the Email Template Screen link

From the agent screen left menu, select Settings > Email > Customer Templates

Editing Customer Email Templates link

  • Select the email template you want to edit and click Edit
  • To create team-specific templates, click the “+ Create Team-Specific Template” button
  • Email configuration options:
    • Notify customers via email when tickets are resolved
    • Retrieve chat conversation logs

Editing Email Body link

  • Select email template format (Plain Text or HTML)
  • Using variables
    • Use variables like {$firstname}
    • Variables allow data insertion based on ticket conditions and assigned agents

Important Notes When Editing Email Templates link

  • Backup the original template before editing
  • Utilize “Quote Options”
  • Use the “Test Send” function

Email Template Variable List link

Available Merge Fields link

Data Type Variable
Server Information Server date, Server time
Ticket Information Ticket subject, Ticket code, Ticket ID, Ticket status, Ticket URL
Recipient Information Recipient name (last/first), Recipient email address
Agent Information Agent ID, Agent last/first name
Others Message, Latest message from requester

Notes on Recipient Name Variables link

  • Names can be split into first and last names by separating with a half-width space
  • Pay attention to variable order (first part is first name, latter part is last name)

Editing Agent Templates link

  • The editing procedure for agent templates is the same as for customer templates
  • Select the template you want to edit and click “Edit”

item.title: Email Settings
item.description:
Automatic Ticket Conversion Setup for Email Accounts link

LiveAgent automatically converts incoming emails into tickets by setting up an email account for inquiry emails.

Steps to Add an Email Account link

  1. From the agent screen left menu, select Settings > Email > Email Accounts > Add Email Account

  2. Enter the necessary information for the email account and click the “Test Settings” button

Important Notes for Configuration link

Required Settings link

  • Incoming email configuration is mandatory

Email Address Requirements link

  • The email used for account registration must be different from the “owner” and agent email addresses

Optional Settings link

  • Outgoing email configuration should only be set up if you want to send emails through a specific mail server

Support link

  • For any unclear items in the incoming/outgoing email settings, please contact your mail server administrator

item.title: Email Settings > 'Reopening Resolved Tickets'
item.description:
Default Behavior: Automatic Ticket Reopening link

By default, when new replies or additional information are received for resolved tickets, the system automatically reopens the ticket. This enables quick and seamless responses to additional comments or new questions from customers. This is an important feature that improves customer support efficiency.

Basic Settings link

For resolved tickets, the checkbox is ON by default, automatically reopening tickets when customers reply. This setting ensures continuous communication with customers even after closure.

item.title: Export tickets
item.description:
Overview of Ticket Export Feature link

A feature that allows you to export tickets in PDF or HTML format. Useful for external storage, sharing, and creating audit materials.

Main Purpose of the Feature link

This enables easy review of inquiry content and history outside the system, making it valuable for reporting tasks and backup purposes.

Usage Scenarios link

For example, when renewing customer contracts, you can create PDFs of past inquiry history for presentation, or store them in HTML format for audit purposes. It can also be used for analysis in combination with external tools.

item.title: Filters
item.description:
Filter Function Overview link

A feature that sorts large volumes of tickets based on conditions. You can search and classify tickets by status, tags, date, agents, and other criteria.

Support environments often handle hundreds or more tickets simultaneously. The filter function allows you to quickly find target cases and significantly improve work efficiency.

Key Features link

Search and Extraction Function link

  • Search by conditions such as status and tags
  • Quickly extract target cases from large volumes of tickets

Improved Work Efficiency link

  • Significantly improve work efficiency
  • Save and reuse filtering conditions
  • Helpful for prioritizing customer support

item.title: GIFs in tickets
item.description:
What are GIFs in tickets link

A feature that allows the use of animated GIFs within tickets. Compared to static explanations, it enables clearer communication of situations through dynamic visuals.

Benefits of GIFs link

For example, by sharing bug reproduction steps via GIF, both customers and agents can easily understand the situation. Problems that are difficult to convey through text alone can be visually supplemented, reducing the time to resolution.

item.title: How to Allow Responses Only from 'Tickets to Resolve'
item.description:
How to Configure Response Only from “Tickets to Resolve” link

Feature Overview link

If your LiveAgent account role is “Owner” or “Administrator”, you can configure agents registered with the “Agent” role to only respond to tickets from the “Tickets to Resolve” section at the top of the agent panel. With this setting, “Agents” will no longer be able to open tickets from the ticket list to respond (viewing tickets is still possible).

item.description:

There are several implementation methods for rules that automatically assign tickets to agents. Below are specific examples.

Rule 1: Automatic Assignment for All Actions link

Features link

This rule automatically assigns tickets to agents who perform the following actions, not just replying to tickets:

  • Replying to tickets
  • Adding notes
  • Completing tickets with the “Resolve” button

Rule 2: Automatic Assignment for Specific Statuses link

item.description:
Automatic BCC Configuration for Ticket Replies link

While there is no function to automatically insert BCC into ticket replies, it is possible to configure rules to re-send to specified email addresses.

item.description:
What are Bounce Emails link

When customers enter an incorrect email address in contact forms or similar, replies from received tickets will not reach the customer. To receive bounce notification emails (MAILER-DAEMON or Mail Delivery Subsystem) that arrive in such cases, configuration is required on the LiveAgent side.

How to Configure Bounce Email Reception link

Email Settings Configuration link

Go to “Settings” - “Email” - “Email Settings” and enable the following options:

item.title: How to Remove 'Login' and 'My Tickets' Links from Customer Portal Menu
item.description:
How to Hide Menu Links in Customer Portal link

Learn how to hide the “Login” and “My Tickets” menu items in the customer portal.

When Using the “Montana” Theme link

Place the following CSS code in the “Customer Portal” > “Settings” > “Customize Design” > “Design” > “Custom CSS” section of your LiveAgent agent interface.

.MenuLinkI, .MenuLinkT { display:none; }

.montana #menu-item-login, .montana #menu-item-mytickets { display:none; }

Hiding Ticket Submission link

To also hide “Submit Ticket”, go to “Customer Portal” > “Settings” > Submit a Ticket and configure the settings to prohibit ticket submission.

item.title: How to Send Automatic Responses to Customers After Tickets Are Created
item.description:
Setting Up Automatic Ticket Responses in LiveAgent link

Basic Scope of Automatic Responses link

LiveAgent makes it easy to create automatic responses using the rules feature.

Use different “Apply” settings depending on whether you want to use automatic responses for all new tickets (including tickets created from contact forms) or only for tickets created from emails:

  • Ticket is created
  • Ticket created from email

Available Actions for Automatic Responses link

There are two actions available for automatic response rules:

item.title: Hybrid Ticket Stream
item.description:
What is Hybrid Ticket Stream link

Hybrid Ticket Stream is a feature that consolidates interactions from different channels into a single ticket. It centralizes inquiries from email, chat, phone, and social media (Facebook, Twitter, etc.).

Key Features and Benefits link

For example, when a customer initially asks a question via chat and then follows up with additional contact through email or phone, all interactions are displayed as one thread. This improves response speed and accuracy, leading to higher customer satisfaction.

item.title: Is there a system to share smart ticket content with customers?
item.description:
Smart Ticket Content Sharing Methods link

Using “My Tickets” in the Customer Portal link

Customers can view all tickets from their past inquiries on the “My Tickets” section of the customer portal installed in LiveAgent. The shared information includes only exchanges between agents and customers, with internal information such as notes not displayed.

User Registration Process link

When customers use My Tickets, user registration is required. By registering the email address used for inquiries, all tickets related to that user information will be linked.

item.title: Keyboard Shortcuts
item.description:
Keyboard Shortcuts Overview link

LiveAgent offers various keyboard shortcuts to improve productivity. Below are the main shortcuts organized by function.

Navigation Shortcuts link

  • CTRL + H - Navigate to the home tab
  • CTRL + ↑ - Move to the next open ticket tab
  • CTRL + ↓ - Move to the previous open ticket tab

Ticket Management Shortcuts link

  • CTRL + D - Open “Tickets to Resolve” (if there are tickets to resolve)
  • CTRL + E - Resolve ticket
  • CTRL + Q - Close ticket window
  • CTRL + Left Click - Open ticket in background (only from ticket list view)

Message Operation Shortcuts link

  • CTRL + I - Display “Email Templates” list (when creating new ticket or replying to ticket)
  • CTRL + K - Display “Frequently Used Phrases” list (when replying to ticket or handling chat)
  • CTRL + SPACE - Display “Frequently Used Phrases” list (same as CTRL + K)
  • CTRL + S - Send message

Chat Shortcuts link

  • CTRL + M - Respond to chat
  • CTRL + SHIFT + M - Respond to chat in background

item.title: LiveAgent for First-Time Users
item.description:
What is LiveAgent: A Helpdesk Tool for Centralized Customer Communication Management link

Has there ever been such a rich era of communication touchpoints between customers and companies? Particularly in BtoC business scenarios, it is well known that “customer voices” through communication channels not typically used for support (such as social media) have a strong influence on purchasing decisions.

We must transition from traditional customer support methods like “telephone” and “email” to an environment where customer voices can be heard more easily. This requires establishing support channels closest to customers and implementing customer support tools that can share response status in real-time within the company, which is crucial for rapid response.

item.title: LiveAgent Operation Screen
item.description:
LiveAgent Operation Screen After Login link

When you log in to LiveAgent as an agent, the dashboard screen is displayed. From this main screen, you can handle customer support and configure internal settings.

Dashboard Screen Overview link

Performance Management link

Currently Active Response Channels link

Displays the communication channels available for response by the logged-in agent. When the icon is green, it indicates online (available for response), and it turns gray when offline. You can manually switch between online/offline by clicking the icon.

item.title: Manually Creating Smart Tickets
item.description:
About Manual Creation of Smart Tickets link

LiveAgent tickets can be created from each configured channel, as well as manually created by agents themselves. The types of tickets that can be newly created are as follows:

New Ticket link

A ticket created from “New Ticket” is equivalent to creating a new email to a customer. You need to create the “To (= customer),” “Sender (can be set by team),” “Subject,” and “Body.”

item.title: Mass actions
item.description:
What are Mass actions link

A feature that allows simultaneous processing of multiple tickets. You can execute operations like tagging, status changes, and deletion in bulk.

The Need for Mass actions link

When processing large volumes of tickets in support environments, handling them one by one is inefficient. Mass actions save time and reduce the burden on staff members.

Key Features of Mass actions link

Key Points:

  • Bulk operations possible on multiple tickets
  • Process tagging and status changes collectively
  • Helps streamline high-volume processing
  • Reduces agent work time
  • Lightens administrative workload

item.title: Multiple ticket tabs
item.description:
Overview of Multiple Ticket Tabs link

Feature Description link

A feature that allows you to work on multiple tickets simultaneously. You can handle them by switching between tab formats, making parallel processing smooth.

Benefits and Background link

Especially in busy support environments, it’s necessary to process multiple cases simultaneously in parallel. The tab switching feature enables agents to work efficiently.

Key Feature Benefits link

Productivity Improvement link

  • Ability to open and work on multiple tickets simultaneously
  • Easy switching with tab format
  • Helps streamline parallel processing
  • Reduces work time and improves productivity
  • Reduces stress in busy environments

item.title: Notes Feature
item.description:
Notes Feature Overview link

A feature that allows you to add internal memos to tickets. These are not visible to customers and are useful for handovers between staff members and sharing important notes.

Use Cases link

For example, by leaving supplementary information such as “This customer has received a refund in the past,” the next staff member can respond with an understanding of the background.

Main Features link

Adding Private Memos link

  • Ability to add internal private memos

Communication Support link

  • Effective for handovers and sharing important notes
  • Enables consistent responses across the entire team

Information Management link

  • Manage information without showing unnecessary details to customers
  • Improve accuracy of response history

item.title: Online Ticket History URL
item.description:
Overview of Online Ticket History URL link

Feature Description link

A feature that allows you to share the complete history of a ticket as a URL. You can easily present the response history to customers or other departments.

Usage Scenarios link

For example, when a customer says “I want to check our previous interactions,” you can send them a dedicated URL to review the past history at a glance. This is also useful for inter-departmental coordination.

item.title: Pause Feature
item.description:
Overview of the Pause Feature link

A feature that temporarily stops automatic ticket assignment. Useful for breaks or when focusing on other tasks.

This prevents new tickets from being assigned when agents are unavailable, helping to avoid workflow disruptions. It can be used safely even for short breaks.

Key Features and Benefits link

Temporary Suspension of Auto-Assignment link

  • Can temporarily pause automatic assignment
  • Flexible response according to agent’s work situation

Improved Work Efficiency link

  • Enables focus on breaks or other tasks
  • Prevents workflow disruptions
  • Reduces agent burden

Work Style Support link

  • Supports flexible work styles
  • Accommodates short-term absences

item.title: POP3 Access to Google Apps Email Account
item.description:
POP3 Access Setup Guide for Google Apps Email Account link

Overview link

To integrate your Google Apps-hosted email account with LiveAgent, follow these steps.

Step 1: Set Access Permissions in Google Apps Account link

Log in to your Google Apps account and grant access to your email account.

For detailed instructions, please refer to: https://support.google.com/a/answer/105694?hl=ja

item.title: Processing Smart Tickets
item.description:
Ticket Overview link

When you click on an individual ticket from the ticket list, you can view the ticket details (inquiry content). The mission of agents (support staff) is to provide appropriate responses to these tickets and resolve customer issues.

Ticket Status link

Tickets have the following four statuses. Handle processing according to the ticket’s situation.

New Status link

This is a newly issued ticket. It’s waiting for an agent to handle it. Previously, work began when staff members checked emails sent to them or reviewed inquiries from the website’s contact page, but with LiveAgent, you can immediately start handling newly generated tickets just by logging in.

item.title: Responsibility Assignment
item.description:
Overview of Responsibility Assignment Feature link

The responsibility assignment feature clarifies response accountability by assigning responsible parties to tickets. It allows you to see at a glance who is in charge and prevents confusion within the team.

Purpose and Effects of Responsibility Assignment link

For example, by assigning a specific agent as the responsible party for complex issues, the location of progress management and final decision-making becomes clear. As a result, it prevents abandonment and duplicate responses, supporting smooth business operations.

item.title: Smart Ticket Deletion and Restoration
item.description:
Ticket Deletion and Management link

Deleting Tickets link

Tickets can be deleted from individual ticket screens. By selecting “Delete” from the bottom menu of the individual ticket screen, the ticket will be removed from the ticket list.

Complete Ticket Purging Methods link

Even after deleting tickets using the “Delete Ticket” function above, tickets are not completely purged from the system. There are two methods to purge (completely delete) tickets.

System Retention Period Settings link

You can set the period before tickets are purged. The default setting is “30 days”.

item.title: Spam Filters
item.description:
Overview of Spam Filters link

Spam filters are a feature that automatically filters out spam emails and unwanted inquiries. Support staff can focus on handling legitimate customer support.

Main Benefits of Spam Filters link

Reduces the risk of mistakenly processing spam as customer inquiries and eliminates wasted effort. Accurate classification also improves response efficiency.

Feature Details link

Spam Detection Characteristics link

Key Points:

  • Automatically detect spam emails
  • Exclude unwanted inquiries from the system
  • Reduce agent workload
  • Enable focus on legitimate customer support
  • Significantly improve response efficiency

Expected Results link

Improved Operational Efficiency link

The implementation of spam filters can be expected to deliver the following benefits:

item.title: Split Tickets
item.description:
Overview of Split Tickets link

Split tickets is a feature that allows you to divide one ticket into multiple tickets, each assignable to different agents or departments. This is useful when multiple issues are included in a single ticket.

Use Cases link

For example, when a customer simultaneously submits a “login issue” and a “billing question,” each can be split into independent tickets and assigned to specialized departments.

Benefits link

Flexible Issue Handling link

  • Multiple issues can be split into independent tickets
  • Proper distribution to highly specialized departments

Improved Business Efficiency link

  • Enhanced response speed
  • Improved accuracy of customer responses
  • Ability to organize complex inquiries

item.title: System Requirements (Agent Side)
item.description:
Supported Devices and OS link

LiveAgent supports Windows and Mac desktop/laptop computers as well as smartphones and tablets such as iPhone/iPad/Android, provided there is an internet connection.

Desktop Environment link

Windows link

  • Microsoft Windows 10 or later

Mac link

  • Apple Mac OS X

Mobile Environment link

Smartphones & Tablets link

  • Apple iOS
  • Google Android

Feature Limitations During Use link

Mobile Browser Limitations link

  • Chat reception is not available when using browsers on smartphones and tablet PCs. If you wish to use chat functionality, please use the dedicated apps mentioned below.

item.title: Ticket Fields
item.description:
Overview of Ticket Fields link

A feature that allows you to add custom fields to tickets to store additional information. You can flexibly configure fields beyond standard items.

Use Cases for Ticket Fields link

For example, by adding information such as “order number” or “contract plan” as fields, support staff can quickly understand the customer’s background.

Key Features of Ticket Fields link

Flexible Information Management link

  • Ability to add custom items to tickets
  • Store background information about customers and cases
  • Flexible management tailored to business needs

Improved Support Quality link

  • Enhanced efficiency and accuracy of response
  • Achieve support that increases customer satisfaction

item.title: Ticket Merge (Merge tickets)
item.description:
Overview of Ticket Merge link

Ticket merge is a feature that consolidates multiple tickets related to the same customer or identical content into one. It enables centralized management even when inquiries are scattered.

Specific Examples of Ticket Merge link

For example, when the same customer sends the same problem via both email and chat, tickets can be merged and consolidated into a single thread. This prevents duplicate responses and confusion.

item.title: Ticket System
item.description:
Ticket System Overview link

The ticket system provides a mechanism to centrally manage all customer inquiries (email, chat, phone, social media, etc.) as “tickets”. When inquiries arrive, tickets are automatically generated and assigned status levels (e.g., new, in progress, resolved).

Benefits of Ticket Management link

This prevents missed responses and duplicate handling, enabling smooth customer service. All tickets are saved as history, allowing for contextual responses while reviewing past interactions.

item.title: Ticket/Customer Insights CRM
item.description:
Overview of Ticket/Customer Insights CRM link

Ticket/Customer Insights is a feature that enables the use of customer information and ticket history as a CRM (Customer Relationship Management) system. By adding detailed customer information and referencing it alongside interaction history, you can provide more accurate support.

Use Cases link

For example, if you save customer purchase history or contract details as insights, agents can quickly check them when responding to inquiries, enabling answers tailored to individual needs.

item.title: Universal inbox
item.description:
Overview of Universal inbox link

Feature Definition link

A feature that centrally aggregates and manages inquiries from all channels including email, chat, phone, and social media. Agents no longer need to switch between multiple tools.

Usage Examples link

For example, even if a customer asks a question via email in the morning and follows up on social media in the afternoon, the universal inbox displays everything on a single screen. This enables smooth responses without missing any interactions.

item.title: Using GeoIP Functionality
item.description:
Using GeoIP Functionality link

What is GeoIP link

With GeoIP functionality, you can automatically retrieve and display location information of your website visitors.

Available Information link

Location Details link

  • Visitor’s country
  • Approximate city name
  • Estimated language usage

Benefits of Use link

Business Application Scenarios link

  • Automatically route overseas inquiries to English support teams
  • Analyze regional inquiry trends
  • Understand response times considering time zone differences

Configuration Method link

You can enable it from “Settings” → “System” → “GeoIP” in the admin panel.

item.title: What are Smart Tickets
item.description:
What are Smart Tickets link

Basic Concept of Tickets link

A “ticket” is a visualization of customer inquiries and communication with agents.

Supported Inquiry Channels link

Regardless of the inquiry channel used by customers, one ticket is issued per inquiry, recording all history including mutual interactions between agents and customers.

Main Supported Channels link

  • Email
  • Live chat
  • Phone and voice calls
  • Facebook and Twitter
  • Messages from web inquiry forms
  • Internal tickets (internal team notes for information sharing)

item.title: What is the difference between 'Spam' and 'Mark as Spam'?
item.description:
Overview link

There are differences in behavior between “Spam” in the ticket screen and the rule action “Mark as Spam”.

“Spam” in the Ticket Screen link

Ticket Processing link

The ticket is treated as spam and excluded from the ticket list.

Forum Post Deletion link

For tickets created from forum posts, the posts are also deleted from the forum.

Rule Action “Mark as Spam” link

Exclusion from Ticket List link

Can be configured to exclude from the ticket list as spam.

item.title: When Simulating Operations with Multiple Operators
item.description:
Agent Addition Overview link

In the trial version, you can add agents (login IDs) from within the agent screen after logging in.

Agent Addition Procedure link

Accessing the Agent Creation Screen link

  • From the left menu, click “Settings” > “Agents” > “Create Agent”.

Entering Agent Information link

  • Enter the agent’s name and email address, and select their role and gender (adding a photo is optional).

Completing Agent Creation link

  • Click “Create” and a notification email will be sent to the entered address. Once the recipient sets a password using the received email, the additional setup is complete.
